stops.title: Cradle of Greenville
stops.description: Discover how this scenic spot became the birthplace of modern Greenville. Learn about the visionaries who transformed a small mill town into South Carolina's most vibrant city.

stops.title: Liberty Bridge — Falls Park Entrance
stops.description: Stand on the iconic suspension bridge that offers breathtaking views of Reedy River Falls. This architectural marvel serves as the gateway to Falls Park and symbolizes Greenville's renaissance.

stops.title: Reedy River Falls and Old Mill Ruins
stops.description: Marvel at the 30-foot cascading falls and explore the haunting ruins of the old Vardry McBee grist mill. These stone foundations tell the story of Greenville's industrial origins and the power that built a city.

stops.title: Wyche Pavilion
stops.description: Experience the elegant Wyche Pavilion, where community gatherings and celebrations bring Falls Park to life. This covered pavilion honors the Wyche family's contributions to Greenville's cultural heritage.

stops.title: Charles H. Townes
stops.description: Pay tribute to Nobel Prize winner Charles H. Townes, Greenville's most celebrated scientist and inventor of the laser. His groundbreaking work changed the world and brought international recognition to his hometown.

stops.title: The Medusa Tree & Furman University
stops.description: Meet the mysterious Medusa Tree with its writhing, twisted branches that captivate visitors year-round. Discover Furman University's deep roots in Greenville and its role in shaping the city's educational legacy.

stops.title: Falls Park Gardens (Closing Stop)
stops.description: Conclude your journey in the beautifully landscaped gardens where nature and design create perfect harmony. Reflect on Greenville's remarkable transformation and discover why this city continues to inspire visitors from around the world.
